name: Chewy Vegan Brownies
description: These vegan brownies are incredibly chewy and fudgy with a crispy top and edges. They remind me of the boxed brownies I used to eat, but better!
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup dairy free chocolate chips, divided

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease an 8x8 inch baking pan or line with parchment paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease an 8x8 inch baking pan or line with parchment paper.

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the flax egg by combining ground flax and water in a small bowl. Set aside to let thicken for a few minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare the flax egg by combining ground flax and water in a small bowl. Set aside to let thicken for a few minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, combine the flour, almond flour, salt and baking soda. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium bowl, combine the flour, almond flour, salt and baking soda. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large microwave safe bowl, add the cocoa, vegan butter, 1/2 cup chocolate chips and water. Melt in the microwave in 30 second increments until mostly melted, and stir well at each interval. It took me 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large microwave safe bowl, add the cocoa, vegan butter, 1/2 cup chocolate chips and water. Melt in the microwave in 30 second increments until mostly melted, and stir well at each interval. It took me 2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the sugar and vanilla to the melted chocolate mixture. Mix well with a wooden spoon. Now add the flax egg and mix again until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the sugar and vanilla to the melted chocolate mixture. Mix well with a wooden spoon. Now add the flax egg and mix again until well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the flour mixture to the large bowl and stir until just combined. The mixture will be thick, that's how it should be, this is what will make them chewy. Fold in the remaining 1/4 cup chocolate chips.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the flour mixture to the large bowl and stir until just combined. The mixture will be thick, that's how it should be, this is what will make them chewy. Fold in the remaining 1/4 cup chocolate chips.

recipeInstructions.text: Scoop the brownie batter into prepared pan and press it down evenly with your hands or a spatula. Bake for 25-28 minutes. Let sit for at least 20 minutes before cutting if you can wait that long!
recipeInstructions.name: Scoop the brownie batter into prepared pan and press it down evenly with your hands or a spatula. Bake for 25-28 minutes. Let sit for at least 20 minutes before cutting if you can wait that long!
